title: User Authentication and Security Framework
summary: Implement secure login with multi-factor authentication and session management.
description: Develop a robust authentication module that enables customers to securely log into the self-service portal using multi-factor authentication. This includes user credential storage with encryption, support for OTP or biometric verification, secure session handling, and timeout mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access. The system should comply with industry-standard security protocols and data protection regulations.

title: Personalized User Dashboard
summary: Design and implement a dashboard that displays user-specific banking products and services.
description: Create a personalized dashboard that dynamically presents available banking products, services, and account summaries tailored to each customer's profile and eligibility. The dashboard should surface relevant actions, highlight recent transactions or notifications, and provide quick access to common tasks. Personalization logic should be driven by user profile data and integrated with the core banking system to ensure real-time accuracy.

title: Responsive UI/UX Design and Device Compatibility
summary: Develop a consistent, responsive interface for desktop, tablet, and mobile access.
description: Ensure the portal interface is fully responsive and delivers a seamless experience across multiple devices. Implement adaptive layouts, accessible design standards, and optimized performance for different screen sizes. The interface should maintain consistent navigation, branding, and usability standards regardless of device type, providing customers with the same level of service quality on all platforms.

title: Account Opening and Service Modification Workflows
summary: Implement online workflows for account creation and service modification requests.
description: Build streamlined workflow processes that allow customers to open new accounts, modify services, and submit requests with minimal clicks. Include features such as form auto-filling from stored data, progress tracking, inline validations, and submission confirmation. Workflows should integrate with back-office systems to ensure requests are automatically routed for approval and processing, minimizing manual effort.

title: Request Tracking, Notifications, and Status Updates
summary: Enable real-time request tracking, email notifications, and user alerts.
description: Develop a system for real-time status updates and notifications that inform customers about the progress of their submitted account and service requests. Implement triggers for key events such as request submission, approval, or completion. Integrate with the bank’s email service for automated notifications, and display in-app alerts within the dashboard to keep users informed of any changes or required actions.

title: Document Upload and Application Resume Capability
summary: Allow users to upload documents securely and resume incomplete applications.
description: Implement a document management feature enabling users to securely upload required supporting documents directly through the portal. Include functionality to encrypt uploaded files, validate accepted formats, and associate documents with their relevant requests. Provide save-and-resume capability so users can pause incomplete forms and return later without losing progress, ensuring convenience and continuity of experience.

title: Integration with Core Banking System
summary: Integrate the self-service portal with the existing core banking system for data synchronization.
description: Design and implement secure API integrations with the bank’s core banking system to enable real-time data exchange for account information, transactions, and user eligibility checks. The integration layer should ensure data consistency, enforce strict security controls, and provide error-handling mechanisms to deal with service interruptions. The system should use asynchronous updates and caching to maintain performance and reliability.

title: Data Management and Independent Database Optimization
summary: Establish a dedicated database for portal performance and reliability.
description: Set up a separate, optimized database to manage user sessions, requests, and interaction history without overloading the core banking system. Implement proper indexing, backup procedures, and failover mechanisms to ensure data reliability and quick access. The solution must synchronize with the core banking data layer using secure middleware while maintaining independence for high availability and performance.

title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
summary: Implement access control based on user roles and authorization levels.
description: Develop a role-based access control system to restrict access to services and modules based on user roles and authority levels. This includes creating user role hierarchies, mapping permissions, and enforcing authorization checks at both the UI and API levels. The RBAC system should ensure that users can only view or perform actions for which they are explicitly authorized, enhancing overall system security.

title: Activity History and Auditing Framework
summary: Implement detailed activity tracking and history maintenance for all user interactions.
description: Develop a comprehensive activity history and auditing framework that logs all user interactions within the portal, including requests, uploads, modifications, and status changes. Provide customers with an interface to view their personal interaction history while ensuring that logs are securely stored and accessible to administrators for compliance and troubleshooting purposes. Ensure data retention policies align with regulatory requirements.
